sourcing.instructions: As: Obtain from a chemical supplier or specialty metal distributor. Li: Purchase from a battery materials supplier. Ni: Available at an industrial metals store. P: Available from chemical suppliers. Tm: Sourced from rare earth suppliers.
steps: As: Obtain from a chemical supplier or specialty metal distributor. Li: Purchase from a battery materials supplier. Ni: Available at an industrial metals store. P: Available from chemical suppliers. Tm: Sourced from rare earth suppliers.

1. Weigh each ingredient precisely using an analytical balance. 2. In a clean, dry environment, combine the weighed amounts of As, Li, Ni, P, and Tm in a ceramic crucible. 3. Use a pestle and mortar to grind the mixture thoroughly to ensure homogeneity. 4. Transfer the mixture into a suitable high-density composite mold sized to fit the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh each ingredient precisely using an analytical balance. 2. In a clean, dry environment, combine the weighed amounts of As, Li, Ni, P, and Tm in a ceramic crucible. 3. Use a pestle and mortar to grind the mixture thoroughly to ensure homogeneity. 4. Transfer the mixture into a suitable high-density composite mold sized to fit the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches.

steps: 1. Preheat a furnace to 800°C. 2. Place the mold with the material mixture into the furnace. 3. Maintain this temperature for 4 hours to ensure complete synthesis of the composition.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a furnace to 800°C. 2. Place the mold with the material mixture into the furnace. 3. Maintain this temperature for 4 hours to ensure complete synthesis of the composition.

steps: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature for approximately 6 hours. 2. Avoid rapid cooling to prevent cracking.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature for approximately 6 hours. 2. Avoid rapid cooling to prevent cracking.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the mold. 2. Use a fine-grit sandpaper to smooth out any rough edges and surfaces. 3. Optionally, seal the surface with a protective coating suitable for the material to enhance durability.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the mold. 2. Use a fine-grit sandpaper to smooth out any rough edges and surfaces. 3. Optionally, seal the surface with a protective coating suitable for the material to enhance durability.
